I would beg particularly to recommend, that the fly-wheel of the engine be more weighty than usual, and that it be driven at least twice to every stroke ofthe engine; this,I think, will be found of the greatest benefit, where .the vessel has to meet and overcome the irregular obstructions of the sea, when agitated by a contrary wind. From the additional weight and velocity of the fly-wheel, the vessel would possess such an increase of active power, as to maintain a steady Line of motion, in defiance of the opposing wares, unless the power of the wind was beyond that of a brisk gale, or the rolling of the .sea such as to render it advisable to stay in port. Where thee floor of	the	vessel, will	admit,	the-fly- wheel might be placed at the bottom, as it would then act as ballast, and would rule in the upper part of the vessel;
</text>

<text id="349rf1151311697">
<textF no="1699-1705" no="1706-1712" no="1713-1719" no="1720-1726" no="1727-1733" no="1734-1740" no="1741-1747" no="1748-1754" no="1755-1761" no="1762-1768" no="1769-1775" no="1776-1782" no="1783-1789" no="1790-1796" no="1797-1803" no="1804-1810" no="1811-1817" no="1818-1824" no="1825-1831" no="1832-1838" no="1839-1845" no="1846-1852" no="1853-1859" no="1860-1866" no="1867-1873" no="1874-1880" no="1881-1887" no="1888-1894" no="1895-1901" no="1902-1908" no="1909-1915" no="1916-1922" no="1923-1929" no="1930-1936" no="1937-1943" no="1944-1950" no="1951-1957" no="1958-1964" no="1965-1971" no="1972-1978" no="1979-1985" no="1986-1992" no="1993-1999" no="2000-2006" no="2007-2013">
<textM no="1705-1717" no="1718-1730" no="1731-1743" no="1744-1756" no="1757-1769" no="1770-1782" no="1783-1795" no="1796-1808" no="1809-1821" no="1822-1834" no="1835-1847" no="1848-1860" no="1861-1873" no="1874-1886" no="1887-1899" no="1900-1912" no="1913-1925" no="1926-1938" no="1939-1951" no="1952-1964" no="1965-1977" no="1978-1990" no="1991-2003" no="2004-2016">
<textC no="1706-1726" no="1727-1747" no="1748-1768" no="1769-1789" no="1790-1810" no="1811-1831" no="1832-1852" no="1853-1873" no="1874-1894" no="1895-1915" no="1916-1936" no="1937-1957" no="1958-1978" no="1979-1999" no="2000-2020">
He has since taken Measures to break that Correspondence ; several of the Haidamakees that were taken Prisoners he order'd to be put to Death, and gave the same Treatment to some of his own Vassals for favouring them. Count Munich has made very strong Lines along the Boristhenes, and potted a considerable Part of the Russian Army in them.
</text>

<text id="194dm321169932">
<textF no="1698-1704" no="1705-1711" no="1712-1718" no="1719-1725" no="1726-1732" no="1733-1739" no="1740-1746" no="1747-1753" no="1754-1760" no="1761-1767" no="1768-1774" no="1775-1781" no="1782-1788" no="1789-1795" no="1796-1802" no="1803-1809" no="1810-1816" no="1817-1823" no="1824-1830" no="1831-1837" no="1838-1844" no="1845-1851" no="1852-1858" no="1859-1865" no="1866-1872" no="1873-1879" no="1880-1886" no="1887-1893" no="1894-1900" no="1901-1907" no="1908-1914" no="1915-1921" no="1922-1928" no="1929-1935" no="1936-1942" no="1943-1949" no="1950-1956" no="1957-1963" no="1964-1970" no="1971-1977" no="1978-1984" no="1985-1991" no="1992-1998" no="1999-2005" no="2006-2012" no="2013-2019">
<textM no="1702-1714" no="1715-1727" no="1728-1740" no="1741-1753" no="1754-1766" no="1767-1779" no="1780-1792" no="1793-1805" no="1806-1818" no="1819-1831" no="1832-1844" no="1845-1857" no="1858-1870" no="1871-1883" no="1884-1896" no="1897-1909" no="1910-1922" no="1923-1935" no="1936-1948" no="1949-1961" no="1962-1974" no="1975-1987" no="1988-2000" no="2001-2013">
<textC no="1698-1718" no="1719-1739" no="1740-1760" no="1761-1781" no="1782-1802" no="1803-1823" no="1824-1844" no="1845-1865" no="1866-1886" no="1887-1907" no="1908-1928" no="1929-1949" no="1950-1970" no="1971-1991" no="1992-2012" no="2013-2033">
THIS is to give Notice, that Christopher Trim, Surgeon, died July 14. 1707. at Mr. William Sims, at the White House inPortsmouth, and left a Box of Instruments, with three Suits of Cloaths.
</text>

<text id="269cl110116109101">
<textF no="1700-1706" no="1707-1713" no="1714-1720" no="1721-1727" no="1728-1734" no="1735-1741" no="1742-1748" no="1749-1755" no="1756-1762" no="1763-1769" no="1770-1776" no="1777-1783" no="1784-1790" no="1791-1797" no="1798-1804" no="1805-1811" no="1812-1818" no="1819-1825" no="1826-1832" no="1833-1839" no="1840-1846" no="1847-1853" no="1854-1860" no="1861-1867" no="1868-1874" no="1875-1881" no="1882-1888" no="1889-1895" no="1896-1902" no="1903-1909" no="1910-1916" no="1917-1923" no="1924-1930" no="1931-1937" no="1938-1944" no="1945-1951" no="1952-1958" no="1959-1965" no="1966-1972" no="1973-1979" no="1980-1986" no="1987-1993" no="1994-2000" no="2001-2007" no="2008-2014">

<textC no="1700-1720" no="1721-1741" no="1742-1762" no="1763-1783" no="1784-1804" no="1805-1825" no="1826-1846" no="1847-1867" no="1868-1888" no="1889-1909" no="1910-1930" no="1931-1951" no="1952-1972" no="1973-1993" no="1994-2014">
on Monday next, the 1st of May, for the Benefit of Hemmings, at the Great Room in York-Buildings, will be performed a Concert of Vocal and Instrumental Musick, by the best Masters. be had Italian several new Cantata's, Songs, and other Pieces pieces of Musick.
</text>

<text id="234jk10411910032">
<textF no="1704-1710" no="1711-1717" no="1718-1724" no="1725-1731" no="1732-1738" no="1739-1745" no="1746-1752" no="1753-1759" no="1760-1766" no="1767-1773" no="1774-1780" no="1781-1787" no="1788-1794" no="1795-1801" no="1802-1808" no="1809-1815" no="1816-1822" no="1823-1829" no="1830-1836" no="1837-1843" no="1844-1850" no="1851-1857" no="1858-1864" no="1865-1871" no="1872-1878" no="1879-1885" no="1886-1892" no="1893-1899" no="1900-1906" no="1907-1913" no="1914-1920" no="1921-1927" no="1928-1934" no="1935-1941" no="1942-1948" no="1949-1955" no="1956-1962" no="1963-1969" no="1970-1976" no="1977-1983" no="1984-1990" no="1991-1997" no="1998-2004" no="2005-2011" no="2012-2018">
<textM no="1695-1707" no="1708-1720" no="1721-1733" no="1734-1746" no="1747-1759" no="1760-1772" no="1773-1785" no="1786-1798" no="1799-1811" no="1812-1824" no="1825-1837" no="1838-1850" no="1851-1863" no="1864-1876" no="1877-1889" no="1890-1902" no="1903-1915" no="1916-1928" no="1929-1941" no="1942-1954" no="1955-1967" no="1968-1980" no="1981-1993" no="1994-2006" no="2007-2019">
<textC no="1704-1724" no="1725-1745" no="1746-1766" no="1767-1787" no="1788-1808" no="1809-1829" no="1830-1850" no="1851-1871" no="1872-1892" no="1893-1913" no="1914-1934" no="1935-1955" no="1956-1976" no="1977-1997" no="1998-2018">
Liveth a Gentle woman, the Daughter of an Eminent Physician who practis'd in London upwards of 40 Years. She has an Ointment call'd the Royal Ointment for the Gout, and of great Ease and comfort of both Sexes and Home and Abroad.
</text>

<text id="334de116109110117">
<textF no="1700-1706" no="1707-1713" no="1714-1720" no="1721-1727" no="1728-1734" no="1735-1741" no="1742-1748" no="1749-1755" no="1756-1762" no="1763-1769" no="1770-1776" no="1777-1783" no="1784-1790" no="1791-1797" no="1798-1804" no="1805-1811" no="1812-1818" no="1819-1825" no="1826-1832" no="1833-1839" no="1840-1846" no="1847-1853" no="1854-1860" no="1861-1867" no="1868-1874" no="1875-1881" no="1882-1888" no="1889-1895" no="1896-1902" no="1903-1909" no="1910-1916" no="1917-1923" no="1924-1930" no="1931-1937" no="1938-1944" no="1945-1951" no="1952-1958" no="1959-1965" no="1966-1972" no="1973-1979" no="1980-1986" no="1987-1993" no="1994-2000" no="2001-2007" no="2008-2014">
<textM no="1698-1710" no="1711-1723" no="1724-1736" no="1737-1749" no="1750-1762" no="1763-1775" no="1776-1788" no="1789-1801" no="1802-1814" no="1815-1827" no="1828-1840" no="1841-1853" no="1854-1866" no="1867-1879" no="1880-1892" no="1893-1905" no="1906-1918" no="1919-1931" no="1932-1944" no="1945-1957" no="1958-1970" no="1971-1983" no="1984-1996" no="1997-2009" no="2010-2022">
<textC no="1707-1727" no="1728-1748" no="1749-1769" no="1770-1790" no="1791-1811" no="1812-1832" no="1833-1853" no="1854-1874" no="1875-1895" no="1896-1916" no="1917-1937" no="1938-1958" no="1959-1979" no="1980-2000" no="2001-2021">
But lest moderate Men may think I wrongfully accuse this sorry Sort of People , let 'em behold their villainous and erroneous Principles as taken very lately from the Mouth of one of the Members of Dr. Welton's Nonjuring Meeting-House whose Eyes are now so much open'd that he hath forsaken that den of Thieves to become a new man.
</text>

<text id="814fj14810911132">
<textF no="1699-1705" no="1706-1712" no="1713-1719" no="1720-1726" no="1727-1733" no="1734-1740" no="1741-1747" no="1748-1754" no="1755-1761" no="1762-1768" no="1769-1775" no="1776-1782" no="1783-1789" no="1790-1796" no="1797-1803" no="1804-1810" no="1811-1817" no="1818-1824" no="1825-1831" no="1832-1838" no="1839-1845" no="1846-1852" no="1853-1859" no="1860-1866" no="1867-1873" no="1874-1880" no="1881-1887" no="1888-1894" no="1895-1901" no="1902-1908" no="1909-1915" no="1916-1922" no="1923-1929" no="1930-1936" no="1937-1943" no="1944-1950" no="1951-1957" no="1958-1964" no="1965-1971" no="1972-1978" no="1979-1985" no="1986-1992" no="1993-1999" no="2000-2006" no="2007-2013">
<textM no="1707-1719" no="1720-1732" no="1733-1745" no="1746-1758" no="1759-1771" no="1772-1784" no="1785-1797" no="1798-1810" no="1811-1823" no="1824-1836" no="1837-1849" no="1850-1862" no="1863-1875" no="1876-1888" no="1889-1901" no="1902-1914" no="1915-1927" no="1928-1940" no="1941-1953" no="1954-1966" no="1967-1979" no="1980-1992" no="1993-2005" no="2006-2018">
<textC no="1699-1719" no="1720-1740" no="1741-1761" no="1762-1782" no="1783-1803" no="1804-1824" no="1825-1845" no="1846-1866" no="1867-1887" no="1888-1908" no="1909-1929" no="1930-1950" no="1951-1971" no="1972-1992" no="1993-2013">
Sir—Having submitted to Lord Panmure your letter, dated the 12th of August, with its enclosures, reporting the satisfactory conclusion of the measures for disbanding the Polish division of the Cossacks of the Sultan, late in her Majesty’s pay, I have the pleasure of conveying to you, by hi3 lordship’s order, the expression of Lord Panmure’s en tire approval of the manner in which that duty has been carried out. His lordship deems this also an appropriateoccasion to convey to you, and, through you, to the officers, non-commissioned, and men lately under your command, i the thanks of her Majesty's Government for the readiness I with which they embraced an occasion for taking service under the British standard, and the zeal and energy displayed by all ranks in the discharge of their duties.
</text>

<text id="618nk1053297110">
<textF no="1702-1708" no="1709-1715" no="1716-1722" no="1723-1729" no="1730-1736" no="1737-1743" no="1744-1750" no="1751-1757" no="1758-1764" no="1765-1771" no="1772-1778" no="1779-1785" no="1786-1792" no="1793-1799" no="1800-1806" no="1807-1813" no="1814-1820" no="1821-1827" no="1828-1834" no="1835-1841" no="1842-1848" no="1849-1855" no="1856-1862" no="1863-1869" no="1870-1876" no="1877-1883" no="1884-1890" no="1891-1897" no="1898-1904" no="1905-1911" no="1912-1918" no="1919-1925" no="1926-1932" no="1933-1939" no="1940-1946" no="1947-1953" no="1954-1960" no="1961-1967" no="1968-1974" no="1975-1981" no="1982-1988" no="1989-1995" no="1996-2002" no="2003-2009" no="2010-2016">
<textM no="1702-1714" no="1715-1727" no="1728-1740" no="1741-1753" no="1754-1766" no="1767-1779" no="1780-1792" no="1793-1805" no="1806-1818" no="1819-1831" no="1832-1844" no="1845-1857" no="1858-1870" no="1871-1883" no="1884-1896" no="1897-1909" no="1910-1922" no="1923-1935" no="1936-1948" no="1949-1961" no="1962-1974" no="1975-1987" no="1988-2000" no="2001-2013">
<textC no="1702-1722" no="1723-1743" no="1744-1764" no="1765-1785" no="1786-1806" no="1807-1827" no="1828-1848" no="1849-1869" no="1870-1890" no="1891-1911" no="1912-1932" no="1933-1953" no="1954-1974" no="1975-1995" no="1996-2016">
The Legislature of Tennessee adjourned on Monday week. The following notice of one of its latest acts is copied fromthe Nashville Whig. the bill to suppress the sale and useof bowie knives deserves to be reckoned among the most salutary acts passed by the late general assembly.	Its provisions will effectually stay the use of one of the most bloody instruments of death known to the present age, and every friend of humanity and good order must rejoice that the practice of wearing this barbarous weapon has been rendered a misdemeanour, and its use, in any way, a felony by the legislative action of the state.
</text>

<text id="412qa119107101117">
<textF no="1698-1704" no="1705-1711" no="1712-1718" no="1719-1725" no="1726-1732" no="1733-1739" no="1740-1746" no="1747-1753" no="1754-1760" no="1761-1767" no="1768-1774" no="1775-1781" no="1782-1788" no="1789-1795" no="1796-1802" no="1803-1809" no="1810-1816" no="1817-1823" no="1824-1830" no="1831-1837" no="1838-1844" no="1845-1851" no="1852-1858" no="1859-1865" no="1866-1872" no="1873-1879" no="1880-1886" no="1887-1893" no="1894-1900" no="1901-1907" no="1908-1914" no="1915-1921" no="1922-1928" no="1929-1935" no="1936-1942" no="1943-1949" no="1950-1956" no="1957-1963" no="1964-1970" no="1971-1977" no="1978-1984" no="1985-1991" no="1992-1998" no="1999-2005" no="2006-2012" no="2013-2019">
<textM no="1701-1713" no="1714-1726" no="1727-1739" no="1740-1752" no="1753-1765" no="1766-1778" no="1779-1791" no="1792-1804" no="1805-1817" no="1818-1830" no="1831-1843" no="1844-1856" no="1857-1869" no="1870-1882" no="1883-1895" no="1896-1908" no="1909-1921" no="1922-1934" no="1935-1947" no="1948-1960" no="1961-1973" no="1974-1986" no="1987-1999" no="2000-2012" no="2013-2025">
<textC no="1691-1711" no="1712-1732" no="1733-1753" no="1754-1774" no="1775-1795" no="1796-1816" no="1817-1837" no="1838-1858" no="1859-1879" no="1880-1900" no="1901-1921" no="1922-1942" no="1943-1963" no="1964-1984" no="1985-2005" no="2006-2026">
But when we take a peep behind the curtain , and observe the Springs of those public transactions, that have such a solemn and specious aspect to the eyes of the world, and compare moreover the characters of men, in point of capacity and principle, with the stations they fill, we then perceive contrasts that justify the title of this Memoir, and which M. WEGUELIN exhibits in a multitude of examples.
</text>

<text id="309ea321332104">
<textF no="1701-1707" no="1708-1714" no="1715-1721" no="1722-1728" no="1729-1735" no="1736-1742" no="1743-1749" no="1750-1756" no="1757-1763" no="1764-1770" no="1771-1777" no="1778-1784" no="1785-1791" no="1792-1798" no="1799-1805" no="1806-1812" no="1813-1819" no="1820-1826" no="1827-1833" no="1834-1840" no="1841-1847" no="1848-1854" no="1855-1861" no="1862-1868" no="1869-1875" no="1876-1882" no="1883-1889" no="1890-1896" no="1897-1903" no="1904-1910" no="1911-1917" no="1918-1924" no="1925-1931" no="1932-1938" no="1939-1945" no="1946-1952" no="1953-1959" no="1960-1966" no="1967-1973" no="1974-1980" no="1981-1987" no="1988-1994" no="1995-2001" no="2002-2008" no="2009-2015">
<textM no="1700-1712" no="1713-1725" no="1726-1738" no="1739-1751" no="1752-1764" no="1765-1777" no="1778-1790" no="1791-1803" no="1804-1816" no="1817-1829" no="1830-1842" no="1843-1855" no="1856-1868" no="1869-1881" no="1882-1894" no="1895-1907" no="1908-1920" no="1921-1933" no="1934-1946" no="1947-1959" no="1960-1972" no="1973-1985" no="1986-1998" no="1999-2011" no="2012-2024">
<textC no="1701-1721" no="1722-1742" no="1743-1763" no="1764-1784" no="1785-1805" no="1806-1826" no="1827-1847" no="1848-1868" no="1869-1889" no="1890-1910" no="1911-1931" no="1932-1952" no="1953-1973" no="1974-1994" no="1995-2015">
And as for our taking an Alarm at the March of some of their Troops to- wards the Coasts of France which lie opposite to England it did not proceed from any Jealousy that subsists between the two Nations, but only from that prudent Jealousy which every Nation ought to have of all its Neighbours,
</text>

<text id="328lk1104410597">
<textF no="1702-1708" no="1709-1715" no="1716-1722" no="1723-1729" no="1730-1736" no="1737-1743" no="1744-1750" no="1751-1757" no="1758-1764" no="1765-1771" no="1772-1778" no="1779-1785" no="1786-1792" no="1793-1799" no="1800-1806" no="1807-1813" no="1814-1820" no="1821-1827" no="1828-1834" no="1835-1841" no="1842-1848" no="1849-1855" no="1856-1862" no="1863-1869" no="1870-1876" no="1877-1883" no="1884-1890" no="1891-1897" no="1898-1904" no="1905-1911" no="1912-1918" no="1919-1925" no="1926-1932" no="1933-1939" no="1940-1946" no="1947-1953" no="1954-1960" no="1961-1967" no="1968-1974" no="1975-1981" no="1982-1988" no="1989-1995" no="1996-2002" no="2003-2009" no="2010-2016">
<textM no="1696-1708" no="1709-1721" no="1722-1734" no="1735-1747" no="1748-1760" no="1761-1773" no="1774-1786" no="1787-1799" no="1800-1812" no="1813-1825" no="1826-1838" no="1839-1851" no="1852-1864" no="1865-1877" no="1878-1890" no="1891-1903" no="1904-1916" no="1917-1929" no="1930-1942" no="1943-1955" no="1956-1968" no="1969-1981" no="1982-1994" no="1995-2007" no="2008-2020">
<textC no="1709-1729" no="1730-1750" no="1751-1771" no="1772-1792" no="1793-1813" no="1814-1834" no="1835-1855" no="1856-1876" no="1877-1897" no="1898-1918" no="1919-1939" no="1940-1960" no="1961-1981" no="1982-2002" no="2003-2023">
Lord Langdale said, the question which had been raised was, whether a solicitor could charge a sum of money advanced bv him on security as a professional disbursement. The sum had been duly paid, and in the ordinary course of business it would have been allowed as a disbursement by the solicitor. to secure the sum of 420l.
</text>

<text id="737mm10810598114">
<textF no="1703-1709" no="1710-1716" no="1717-1723" no="1724-1730" no="1731-1737" no="1738-1744" no="1745-1751" no="1752-1758" no="1759-1765" no="1766-1772" no="1773-1779" no="1780-1786" no="1787-1793" no="1794-1800" no="1801-1807" no="1808-1814" no="1815-1821" no="1822-1828" no="1829-1835" no="1836-1842" no="1843-1849" no="1850-1856" no="1857-1863" no="1864-1870" no="1871-1877" no="1878-1884" no="1885-1891" no="1892-1898" no="1899-1905" no="1906-1912" no="1913-1919" no="1920-1926" no="1927-1933" no="1934-1940" no="1941-1947" no="1948-1954" no="1955-1961" no="1962-1968" no="1969-1975" no="1976-1982" no="1983-1989" no="1990-1996" no="1997-2003" no="2004-2010" no="2011-2017">
<textM no="1695-1707" no="1708-1720" no="1721-1733" no="1734-1746" no="1747-1759" no="1760-1772" no="1773-1785" no="1786-1798" no="1799-1811" no="1812-1824" no="1825-1837" no="1838-1850" no="1851-1863" no="1864-1876" no="1877-1889" no="1890-1902" no="1903-1915" no="1916-1928" no="1929-1941" no="1942-1954" no="1955-1967" no="1968-1980" no="1981-1993" no="1994-2006" no="2007-2019">
<textC no="1710-1730" no="1731-1751" no="1752-1772" no="1773-1793" no="1794-1814" no="1815-1835" no="1836-1856" no="1857-1877" no="1878-1898" no="1899-1919" no="1920-1940" no="1941-1961" no="1962-1982" no="1983-2003" no="2004-2024">
Mr. Rowland Hunt will, no doubt, be interested to hear that the Territorial Association of the county of Surrey is understood to be about to take steps to ascertain as many as possible of the names and addresses of the trained men resident in the county who do not at present belong to any unit of the national forces. If it should prove possible to get into touch in Surrey with even a half of the trained men, a very valuable piece of information will have been obtained, and on such information may later be based some kind of skeleton organisation, The first thing, however,' is to get the names and addresses, and that, thanks to the carelessness of our military administrators in the past, is a most arduous and perplexing task.
</text>

<text id="78ee3232101119">
<textF no="1702-1708" no="1709-1715" no="1716-1722" no="1723-1729" no="1730-1736" no="1737-1743" no="1744-1750" no="1751-1757" no="1758-1764" no="1765-1771" no="1772-1778" no="1779-1785" no="1786-1792" no="1793-1799" no="1800-1806" no="1807-1813" no="1814-1820" no="1821-1827" no="1828-1834" no="1835-1841" no="1842-1848" no="1849-1855" no="1856-1862" no="1863-1869" no="1870-1876" no="1877-1883" no="1884-1890" no="1891-1897" no="1898-1904" no="1905-1911" no="1912-1918" no="1919-1925" no="1926-1932" no="1933-1939" no="1940-1946" no="1947-1953" no="1954-1960" no="1961-1967" no="1968-1974" no="1975-1981" no="1982-1988" no="1989-1995" no="1996-2002" no="2003-2009" no="2010-2016">
<textM no="1700-1712" no="1713-1725" no="1726-1738" no="1739-1751" no="1752-1764" no="1765-1777" no="1778-1790" no="1791-1803" no="1804-1816" no="1817-1829" no="1830-1842" no="1843-1855" no="1856-1868" no="1869-1881" no="1882-1894" no="1895-1907" no="1908-1920" no="1921-1933" no="1934-1946" no="1947-1959" no="1960-1972" no="1973-1985" no="1986-1998" no="1999-2011" no="2012-2024">
<textC no="1709-1729" no="1730-1750" no="1751-1771" no="1772-1792" no="1793-1813" no="1814-1834" no="1835-1855" no="1856-1876" no="1877-1897" no="1898-1918" no="1919-1939" no="1940-1960" no="1961-1981" no="1982-2002" no="2003-2023">
Nothing Remarkable has happened to Day. We have 19 wounded and four killed.
</text>

<text id="258fh10511132119">
<textF no="1702-1708" no="1709-1715" no="1716-1722" no="1723-1729" no="1730-1736" no="1737-1743" no="1744-1750" no="1751-1757" no="1758-1764" no="1765-1771" no="1772-1778" no="1779-1785" no="1786-1792" no="1793-1799" no="1800-1806" no="1807-1813" no="1814-1820" no="1821-1827" no="1828-1834" no="1835-1841" no="1842-1848" no="1849-1855" no="1856-1862" no="1863-1869" no="1870-1876" no="1877-1883" no="1884-1890" no="1891-1897" no="1898-1904" no="1905-1911" no="1912-1918" no="1919-1925" no="1926-1932" no="1933-1939" no="1940-1946" no="1947-1953" no="1954-1960" no="1961-1967" no="1968-1974" no="1975-1981" no="1982-1988" no="1989-1995" no="1996-2002" no="2003-2009" no="2010-2016">
<textM no="1700-1712" no="1713-1725" no="1726-1738" no="1739-1751" no="1752-1764" no="1765-1777" no="1778-1790" no="1791-1803" no="1804-1816" no="1817-1829" no="1830-1842" no="1843-1855" no="1856-1868" no="1869-1881" no="1882-1894" no="1895-1907" no="1908-1920" no="1921-1933" no="1934-1946" no="1947-1959" no="1960-1972" no="1973-1985" no="1986-1998" no="1999-2011" no="2012-2024">
<textC no="1709-1729" no="1730-1750" no="1751-1771" no="1772-1792" no="1793-1813" no="1814-1834" no="1835-1855" no="1856-1876" no="1877-1897" no="1898-1918" no="1919-1939" no="1940-1960" no="1961-1981" no="1982-2002" no="2003-2023">
Our Advices from Norway say, that the Swedes who were advanced towards Drontheim , were reduced to such Extremities, that 'tis be- lieved , most of them will perish with Cold and Hunger in their Retreat : They loft 200 Men in one Night near Buchammer.
</text>

<text id="206ah3211632101">
<textF no="1700-1706" no="1707-1713" no="1714-1720" no="1721-1727" no="1728-1734" no="1735-1741" no="1742-1748" no="1749-1755" no="1756-1762" no="1763-1769" no="1770-1776" no="1777-1783" no="1784-1790" no="1791-1797" no="1798-1804" no="1805-1811" no="1812-1818" no="1819-1825" no="1826-1832" no="1833-1839" no="1840-1846" no="1847-1853" no="1854-1860" no="1861-1867" no="1868-1874" no="1875-1881" no="1882-1888" no="1889-1895" no="1896-1902" no="1903-1909" no="1910-1916" no="1917-1923" no="1924-1930" no="1931-1937" no="1938-1944" no="1945-1951" no="1952-1958" no="1959-1965" no="1966-1972" no="1973-1979" no="1980-1986" no="1987-1993" no="1994-2000" no="2001-2007" no="2008-2014">
<textM no="1698-1710" no="1711-1723" no="1724-1736" no="1737-1749" no="1750-1762" no="1763-1775" no="1776-1788" no="1789-1801" no="1802-1814" no="1815-1827" no="1828-1840" no="1841-1853" no="1854-1866" no="1867-1879" no="1880-1892" no="1893-1905" no="1906-1918" no="1919-1931" no="1932-1944" no="1945-1957" no="1958-1970" no="1971-1983" no="1984-1996" no="1997-2009" no="2010-2022">
<textC no="1707-1727" no="1728-1748" no="1749-1769" no="1770-1790" no="1791-1811" no="1812-1832" no="1833-1853" no="1854-1874" no="1875-1895" no="1896-1916" no="1917-1937" no="1938-1958" no="1959-1979" no="1980-2000" no="2001-2021">
At the same time the French Minister demands Satisfaction for the detaining of some French Ships ; and the Polish Minister complains also of the stopping of the Ships that were going to Leipsick-Fair.
</text>

<text id="283si1019710832">
<textF no="1704-1710" no="1711-1717" no="1718-1724" no="1725-1731" no="1732-1738" no="1739-1745" no="1746-1752" no="1753-1759" no="1760-1766" no="1767-1773" no="1774-1780" no="1781-1787" no="1788-1794" no="1795-1801" no="1802-1808" no="1809-1815" no="1816-1822" no="1823-1829" no="1830-1836" no="1837-1843" no="1844-1850" no="1851-1857" no="1858-1864" no="1865-1871" no="1872-1878" no="1879-1885" no="1886-1892" no="1893-1899" no="1900-1906" no="1907-1913" no="1914-1920" no="1921-1927" no="1928-1934" no="1935-1941" no="1942-1948" no="1949-1955" no="1956-1962" no="1963-1969" no="1970-1976" no="1977-1983" no="1984-1990" no="1991-1997" no="1998-2004" no="2005-2011" no="2012-2018">
<textM no="1695-1707" no="1708-1720" no="1721-1733" no="1734-1746" no="1747-1759" no="1760-1772" no="1773-1785" no="1786-1798" no="1799-1811" no="1812-1824" no="1825-1837" no="1838-1850" no="1851-1863" no="1864-1876" no="1877-1889" no="1890-1902" no="1903-1915" no="1916-1928" no="1929-1941" no="1942-1954" no="1955-1967" no="1968-1980" no="1981-1993" no="1994-2006" no="2007-2019">
<textC no="1711-1731" no="1732-1752" no="1753-1773" no="1774-1794" no="1795-1815" no="1816-1836" no="1837-1857" no="1858-1878" no="1879-1899" no="1900-1920" no="1921-1941" no="1942-1962" no="1963-1983" no="1984-2004" no="2005-2025">
But here Miss Amanda Bristol uncovered her face —which was very pink indeed—and gasped forth:“ Under the circumstances I will no longer con ceal the truth. Mr. Davenport does not intend to propose to either one of you. It was me, all the time, and I have accepted him.”
</text>

<text id="185ad11910232117">
<textF no="1702-1708" no="1709-1715" no="1716-1722" no="1723-1729" no="1730-1736" no="1737-1743" no="1744-1750" no="1751-1757" no="1758-1764" no="1765-1771" no="1772-1778" no="1779-1785" no="1786-1792" no="1793-1799" no="1800-1806" no="1807-1813" no="1814-1820" no="1821-1827" no="1828-1834" no="1835-1841" no="1842-1848" no="1849-1855" no="1856-1862" no="1863-1869" no="1870-1876" no="1877-1883" no="1884-1890" no="1891-1897" no="1898-1904" no="1905-1911" no="1912-1918" no="1919-1925" no="1926-1932" no="1933-1939" no="1940-1946" no="1947-1953" no="1954-1960" no="1961-1967" no="1968-1974" no="1975-1981" no="1982-1988" no="1989-1995" no="1996-2002" no="2003-2009" no="2010-2016">
<textM no="1700-1712" no="1713-1725" no="1726-1738" no="1739-1751" no="1752-1764" no="1765-1777" no="1778-1790" no="1791-1803" no="1804-1816" no="1817-1829" no="1830-1842" no="1843-1855" no="1856-1868" no="1869-1881" no="1882-1894" no="1895-1907" no="1908-1920" no="1921-1933" no="1934-1946" no="1947-1959" no="1960-1972" no="1973-1985" no="1986-1998" no="1999-2011" no="2012-2024">
<textC no="1709-1729" no="1730-1750" no="1751-1771" no="1772-1792" no="1793-1813" no="1814-1834" no="1835-1855" no="1856-1876" no="1877-1897" no="1898-1918" no="1919-1939" no="1940-1960" no="1961-1981" no="1982-2002" no="2003-2023">
They write from France that the late Duke of Ormond continues in Spain, and that he sollicits the Court of Madrid to give him the Command in Chief of his Catholick Majesty's Army
</text>

<text id="333at5011610132">
<textF no="1703-1709" no="1710-1716" no="1717-1723" no="1724-1730" no="1731-1737" no="1738-1744" no="1745-1751" no="1752-1758" no="1759-1765" no="1766-1772" no="1773-1779" no="1780-1786" no="1787-1793" no="1794-1800" no="1801-1807" no="1808-1814" no="1815-1821" no="1822-1828" no="1829-1835" no="1836-1842" no="1843-1849" no="1850-1856" no="1857-1863" no="1864-1870" no="1871-1877" no="1878-1884" no="1885-1891" no="1892-1898" no="1899-1905" no="1906-1912" no="1913-1919" no="1920-1926" no="1927-1933" no="1934-1940" no="1941-1947" no="1948-1954" no="1955-1961" no="1962-1968" no="1969-1975" no="1976-1982" no="1983-1989" no="1990-1996" no="1997-2003" no="2004-2010" no="2011-2017">
<textM no="1700-1712" no="1713-1725" no="1726-1738" no="1739-1751" no="1752-1764" no="1765-1777" no="1778-1790" no="1791-1803" no="1804-1816" no="1817-1829" no="1830-1842" no="1843-1855" no="1856-1868" no="1869-1881" no="1882-1894" no="1895-1907" no="1908-1920" no="1921-1933" no="1934-1946" no="1947-1959" no="1960-1972" no="1973-1985" no="1986-1998" no="1999-2011" no="2012-2024">
<textC no="1696-1716" no="1717-1737" no="1738-1758" no="1759-1779" no="1780-1800" no="1801-1821" no="1822-1842" no="1843-1863" no="1864-1884" no="1885-1905" no="1906-1926" no="1927-1947" no="1948-1968" no="1969-1989" no="1990-2010" no="2011-2031">
On the 20th Instant arrived here several Vessels from Holland, which came from thence under Convoy of the Men of War that attended his Grace the Duke of Marlborough in his Passage. Yesterday several Coasters passed through out Road to the Northward. The same Day alsosailed hence several Vessels for Holland, laden with Herrings.
</text>

<text id="559fc10110110499">
<textF no="1702-1708" no="1709-1715" no="1716-1722" no="1723-1729" no="1730-1736" no="1737-1743" no="1744-1750" no="1751-1757" no="1758-1764" no="1765-1771" no="1772-1778" no="1779-1785" no="1786-1792" no="1793-1799" no="1800-1806" no="1807-1813" no="1814-1820" no="1821-1827" no="1828-1834" no="1835-1841" no="1842-1848" no="1849-1855" no="1856-1862" no="1863-1869" no="1870-1876" no="1877-1883" no="1884-1890" no="1891-1897" no="1898-1904" no="1905-1911" no="1912-1918" no="1919-1925" no="1926-1932" no="1933-1939" no="1940-1946" no="1947-1953" no="1954-1960" no="1961-1967" no="1968-1974" no="1975-1981" no="1982-1988" no="1989-1995" no="1996-2002" no="2003-2009" no="2010-2016">
<textM no="1707-1719" no="1720-1732" no="1733-1745" no="1746-1758" no="1759-1771" no="1772-1784" no="1785-1797" no="1798-1810" no="1811-1823" no="1824-1836" no="1837-1849" no="1850-1862" no="1863-1875" no="1876-1888" no="1889-1901" no="1902-1914" no="1915-1927" no="1928-1940" no="1941-1953" no="1954-1966" no="1967-1979" no="1980-1992" no="1993-2005" no="2006-2018">
<textC no="1702-1722" no="1723-1743" no="1744-1764" no="1765-1785" no="1786-1806" no="1807-1827" no="1828-1848" no="1849-1869" no="1870-1890" no="1891-1911" no="1912-1932" no="1933-1953" no="1954-1974" no="1975-1995" no="1996-2016">
1 beg leave to offer to your honourable Committee, a calculation of the expansive force of the steam in different-sized engines, which, I have no doubt, will make obvious the necessity of some parliamentary regulation in the application of this tremendous and powerful agent. It only requires a few figures, and the perusal of the evidence before your honourable Committee., to show the necessity of something being done without delay, for the sake of humanity, lest another cargo of passengers be destroyed before the necessary precautions can be adopted.
</text>

<text id="202qj116100101114">
<textF no="1700-1706" no="1707-1713" no="1714-1720" no="1721-1727" no="1728-1734" no="1735-1741" no="1742-1748" no="1749-1755" no="1756-1762" no="1763-1769" no="1770-1776" no="1777-1783" no="1784-1790" no="1791-1797" no="1798-1804" no="1805-1811" no="1812-1818" no="1819-1825" no="1826-1832" no="1833-1839" no="1840-1846" no="1847-1853" no="1854-1860" no="1861-1867" no="1868-1874" no="1875-1881" no="1882-1888" no="1889-1895" no="1896-1902" no="1903-1909" no="1910-1916" no="1917-1923" no="1924-1930" no="1931-1937" no="1938-1944" no="1945-1951" no="1952-1958" no="1959-1965" no="1966-1972" no="1973-1979" no="1980-1986" no="1987-1993" no="1994-2000" no="2001-2007" no="2008-2014">
<textM no="1698-1710" no="1711-1723" no="1724-1736" no="1737-1749" no="1750-1762" no="1763-1775" no="1776-1788" no="1789-1801" no="1802-1814" no="1815-1827" no="1828-1840" no="1841-1853" no="1854-1866" no="1867-1879" no="1880-1892" no="1893-1905" no="1906-1918" no="1919-1931" no="1932-1944" no="1945-1957" no="1958-1970" no="1971-1983" no="1984-1996" no="1997-2009" no="2010-2022">
<textC no="1707-1727" no="1728-1748" no="1749-1769" no="1770-1790" no="1791-1811" no="1812-1832" no="1833-1853" no="1854-1874" no="1875-1895" no="1896-1916" no="1917-1937" no="1938-1958" no="1959-1979" no="1980-2000" no="2001-2021">
What art thou bound to believe by this Article ? In the Doctrines of Passive-Obedience and Non-Resistance ; which Duties I owe to any Prince who has an Hereditary, Indefeasable Right to the Crown .
</text>

<text id="500rt329911699">
<textF no="1700-1706" no="1707-1713" no="1714-1720" no="1721-1727" no="1728-1734" no="1735-1741" no="1742-1748" no="1749-1755" no="1756-1762" no="1763-1769" no="1770-1776" no="1777-1783" no="1784-1790" no="1791-1797" no="1798-1804" no="1805-1811" no="1812-1818" no="1819-1825" no="1826-1832" no="1833-1839" no="1840-1846" no="1847-1853" no="1854-1860" no="1861-1867" no="1868-1874" no="1875-1881" no="1882-1888" no="1889-1895" no="1896-1902" no="1903-1909" no="1910-1916" no="1917-1923" no="1924-1930" no="1931-1937" no="1938-1944" no="1945-1951" no="1952-1958" no="1959-1965" no="1966-1972" no="1973-1979" no="1980-1986" no="1987-1993" no="1994-2000" no="2001-2007" no="2008-2014">
<textM no="1700-1712" no="1713-1725" no="1726-1738" no="1739-1751" no="1752-1764" no="1765-1777" no="1778-1790" no="1791-1803" no="1804-1816" no="1817-1829" no="1830-1842" no="1843-1855" no="1856-1868" no="1869-1881" no="1882-1894" no="1895-1907" no="1908-1920" no="1921-1933" no="1934-1946" no="1947-1959" no="1960-1972" no="1973-1985" no="1986-1998" no="1999-2011" no="2012-2024">
<textC no="1700-1720" no="1721-1741" no="1742-1762" no="1763-1783" no="1784-1804" no="1805-1825" no="1826-1846" no="1847-1867" no="1868-1888" no="1889-1909" no="1910-1930" no="1931-1951" no="1952-1972" no="1973-1993" no="1994-2014">
Has had much public and private experience a in engineering. Has known accidents by fire on railways, but could not learn whether they were caused by sparks from the chimney or ushes from the grate. Is of opinion that a hood or a cylinder over the funnel and an ash-box Tinder the grate would	be a preventive. Heat of the fuel should not exceed 1,200 de- H degrees Fahrenheit. Coke is safer than coal. Railway companies a should be prohibited from erecting inflamable buildings near a railways.	
</text>

<text id="324ck1169932109">
<textF no="1704-1710" no="1711-1717" no="1718-1724" no="1725-1731" no="1732-1738" no="1739-1745" no="1746-1752" no="1753-1759" no="1760-1766" no="1767-1773" no="1774-1780" no="1781-1787" no="1788-1794" no="1795-1801" no="1802-1808" no="1809-1815" no="1816-1822" no="1823-1829" no="1830-1836" no="1837-1843" no="1844-1850" no="1851-1857" no="1858-1864" no="1865-1871" no="1872-1878" no="1879-1885" no="1886-1892" no="1893-1899" no="1900-1906" no="1907-1913" no="1914-1920" no="1921-1927" no="1928-1934" no="1935-1941" no="1942-1948" no="1949-1955" no="1956-1962" no="1963-1969" no="1970-1976" no="1977-1983" no="1984-1990" no="1991-1997" no="1998-2004" no="2005-2011" no="2012-2018">
<textM no="1695-1707" no="1708-1720" no="1721-1733" no="1734-1746" no="1747-1759" no="1760-1772" no="1773-1785" no="1786-1798" no="1799-1811" no="1812-1824" no="1825-1837" no="1838-1850" no="1851-1863" no="1864-1876" no="1877-1889" no="1890-1902" no="1903-1915" no="1916-1928" no="1929-1941" no="1942-1954" no="1955-1967" no="1968-1980" no="1981-1993" no="1994-2006" no="2007-2019">
<textC no="1711-1731" no="1732-1752" no="1753-1773" no="1774-1794" no="1795-1815" no="1816-1836" no="1837-1857" no="1858-1878" no="1879-1899" no="1900-1920" no="1921-1941" no="1942-1962" no="1963-1983" no="1984-2004" no="2005-2025">
A guilty conscience forced a blush to Amanda Bristol's cheek—she could hardly look Mr. Daven port in the face as she greeted him. But probably he did not notice that.	He put his hat on the piano, after a fashion he had, and walking up to Miss Bristol, deliberately took lier sewing out of lierI hands and laid it down
</text>

<text id="403ea116114112116">
<textF no="1701-1707" no="1708-1714" no="1715-1721" no="1722-1728" no="1729-1735" no="1736-1742" no="1743-1749" no="1750-1756" no="1757-1763" no="1764-1770" no="1771-1777" no="1778-1784" no="1785-1791" no="1792-1798" no="1799-1805" no="1806-1812" no="1813-1819" no="1820-1826" no="1827-1833" no="1834-1840" no="1841-1847" no="1848-1854" no="1855-1861" no="1862-1868" no="1869-1875" no="1876-1882" no="1883-1889" no="1890-1896" no="1897-1903" no="1904-1910" no="1911-1917" no="1918-1924" no="1925-1931" no="1932-1938" no="1939-1945" no="1946-1952" no="1953-1959" no="1960-1966" no="1967-1973" no="1974-1980" no="1981-1987" no="1988-1994" no="1995-2001" no="2002-2008" no="2009-2015">
<textM no="1699-1711" no="1712-1724" no="1725-1737" no="1738-1750" no="1751-1763" no="1764-1776" no="1777-1789" no="1790-1802" no="1803-1815" no="1816-1828" no="1829-1841" no="1842-1854" no="1855-1867" no="1868-1880" no="1881-1893" no="1894-1906" no="1907-1919" no="1920-1932" no="1933-1945" no="1946-1958" no="1959-1971" no="1972-1984" no="1985-1997" no="1998-2010" no="2011-2023">
<textC no="1708-1728" no="1729-1749" no="1750-1770" no="1771-1791" no="1792-1812" no="1813-1833" no="1834-1854" no="1855-1875" no="1876-1896" no="1897-1917" no="1918-1938" no="1939-1959" no="1960-1980" no="1981-2001" no="2002-2022">
I Am extreamly sorry, so unhappy a Spirit should Reign at this time of the Day, that, after so miraculous a Deliverance as we have had, may endanger our Return again into Egypt. I pray God our Wantonness with so gracious a Providence doth not bring an harder After-Game upon us. It is my Misfortune that I cannot come down just now to clear this Matter. In the mean time take my Thoughts upon it.
</text>

<text id="557gd1013232103">
<textF no="1701-1707" no="1708-1714" no="1715-1721" no="1722-1728" no="1729-1735" no="1736-1742" no="1743-1749" no="1750-1756" no="1757-1763" no="1764-1770" no="1771-1777" no="1778-1784" no="1785-1791" no="1792-1798" no="1799-1805" no="1806-1812" no="1813-1819" no="1820-1826" no="1827-1833" no="1834-1840" no="1841-1847" no="1848-1854" no="1855-1861" no="1862-1868" no="1869-1875" no="1876-1882" no="1883-1889" no="1890-1896" no="1897-1903" no="1904-1910" no="1911-1917" no="1918-1924" no="1925-1931" no="1932-1938" no="1939-1945" no="1946-1952" no="1953-1959" no="1960-1966" no="1967-1973" no="1974-1980" no="1981-1987" no="1988-1994" no="1995-2001" no="2002-2008" no="2009-2015">
<textM no="1707-1719" no="1720-1732" no="1733-1745" no="1746-1758" no="1759-1771" no="1772-1784" no="1785-1797" no="1798-1810" no="1811-1823" no="1824-1836" no="1837-1849" no="1850-1862" no="1863-1875" no="1876-1888" no="1889-1901" no="1902-1914" no="1915-1927" no="1928-1940" no="1941-1953" no="1954-1966" no="1967-1979" no="1980-1992" no="1993-2005" no="2006-2018">
<textC no="1694-1714" no="1715-1735" no="1736-1756" no="1757-1777" no="1778-1798" no="1799-1819" no="1820-1840" no="1841-1861" no="1862-1882" no="1883-1903" no="1904-1924" no="1925-1945" no="1946-1966" no="1967-1987" no="1988-2008" no="2009-2029">
the gate. way from the Castle to the Long Walk is open all day long. Then there are deer and partridges, and embrowning woods ; but these, to be sure, are nothing new. Beasts and birds and nodding trees were to be found in Windsor Park before the foundations of the Round Tower were dug. Taking, however, the advantages of William's reign and of Nature's together, the Windsor folks deem their neighbourhood at this pleasure-seeking season, much more deserving of the pleasure-seeker's attention than all the " shallow fopperies" of the watering-places.
</text>

<text id="540ao10932115108">

<textC no="1702-1722" no="1723-1743" no="1744-1764" no="1765-1785" no="1786-1806" no="1807-1827" no="1828-1848" no="1849-1869" no="1870-1890" no="1891-1911" no="1912-1932" no="1933-1953" no="1954-1974" no="1975-1995" no="1996-2016">
or the more minute particulars the details in the annexed drawing may be referred to. Fig. 1 (Piate VII.) is a view of the lock-plate, with theimproved pan applied to it. A, is the pan. B, the tube or chamber in the pan, in a line with the touch-hole of the bairel. C, the interior, or open end of the tube Dj the free or open space between the interior end of the tube and the touch-hole of the gun. E the hole, resembling a touch-hole, on the surface of and into the tube, near its outward or closed end.	F, the outward or closed end.
</text>

<text id="362ib9711111699">
<textF no="1702-1708" no="1709-1715" no="1716-1722" no="1723-1729" no="1730-1736" no="1737-1743" no="1744-1750" no="1751-1757" no="1758-1764" no="1765-1771" no="1772-1778" no="1779-1785" no="1786-1792" no="1793-1799" no="1800-1806" no="1807-1813" no="1814-1820" no="1821-1827" no="1828-1834" no="1835-1841" no="1842-1848" no="1849-1855" no="1856-1862" no="1863-1869" no="1870-1876" no="1877-1883" no="1884-1890" no="1891-1897" no="1898-1904" no="1905-1911" no="1912-1918" no="1919-1925" no="1926-1932" no="1933-1939" no="1940-1946" no="1947-1953" no="1954-1960" no="1961-1967" no="1968-1974" no="1975-1981" no="1982-1988" no="1989-1995" no="1996-2002" no="2003-2009" no="2010-2016">
<textM no="1700-1712" no="1713-1725" no="1726-1738" no="1739-1751" no="1752-1764" no="1765-1777" no="1778-1790" no="1791-1803" no="1804-1816" no="1817-1829" no="1830-1842" no="1843-1855" no="1856-1868" no="1869-1881" no="1882-1894" no="1895-1907" no="1908-1920" no="1921-1933" no="1934-1946" no="1947-1959" no="1960-1972" no="1973-1985" no="1986-1998" no="1999-2011" no="2012-2024">
<textC no="1709-1729" no="1730-1750" no="1751-1771" no="1772-1792" no="1793-1813" no="1814-1834" no="1835-1855" no="1856-1876" no="1877-1897" no="1898-1918" no="1919-1939" no="1940-1960" no="1961-1981" no="1982-2002" no="2003-2023">
He hath set up one at Shaftsbuiy, which after Conveying the Water near two Miles , Raises it above 300 Foot perpendicular into the Town , for the use of the Inhabitants, and several others he hath erected at the Earls of Pembroke , and Rockingham , the Lord Viscount Townshend's , and Mr . Doddmgcon's Country Seats, which gives general Satisfaction;
</text>

<text id="131dg32979832">
<textF no="1700-1706" no="1707-1713" no="1714-1720" no="1721-1727" no="1728-1734" no="1735-1741" no="1742-1748" no="1749-1755" no="1756-1762" no="1763-1769" no="1770-1776" no="1777-1783" no="1784-1790" no="1791-1797" no="1798-1804" no="1805-1811" no="1812-1818" no="1819-1825" no="1826-1832" no="1833-1839" no="1840-1846" no="1847-1853" no="1854-1860" no="1861-1867" no="1868-1874" no="1875-1881" no="1882-1888" no="1889-1895" no="1896-1902" no="1903-1909" no="1910-1916" no="1917-1923" no="1924-1930" no="1931-1937" no="1938-1944" no="1945-1951" no="1952-1958" no="1959-1965" no="1966-1972" no="1973-1979" no="1980-1986" no="1987-1993" no="1994-2000" no="2001-2007" no="2008-2014">

and the greatest Part of the Bishopricks and Livings would have been pronounc'd void, to make way for Sandals and snav'd Crowns.

<text id="542sn111102111118">
<textF no="1698-1704" no="1705-1711" no="1712-1718" no="1719-1725" no="1726-1732" no="1733-1739" no="1740-1746" no="1747-1753" no="1754-1760" no="1761-1767" no="1768-1774" no="1775-1781" no="1782-1788" no="1789-1795" no="1796-1802" no="1803-1809" no="1810-1816" no="1817-1823" no="1824-1830" no="1831-1837" no="1838-1844" no="1845-1851" no="1852-1858" no="1859-1865" no="1866-1872" no="1873-1879" no="1880-1886" no="1887-1893" no="1894-1900" no="1901-1907" no="1908-1914" no="1915-1921" no="1922-1928" no="1929-1935" no="1936-1942" no="1943-1949" no="1950-1956" no="1957-1963" no="1964-1970" no="1971-1977" no="1978-1984" no="1985-1991" no="1992-1998" no="1999-2005" no="2006-2012" no="2013-2019">
<textM no="1696-1708" no="1709-1721" no="1722-1734" no="1735-1747" no="1748-1760" no="1761-1773" no="1774-1786" no="1787-1799" no="1800-1812" no="1813-1825" no="1826-1838" no="1839-1851" no="1852-1864" no="1865-1877" no="1878-1890" no="1891-1903" no="1904-1916" no="1917-1929" no="1930-1942" no="1943-1955" no="1956-1968" no="1969-1981" no="1982-1994" no="1995-2007" no="2008-2020">
<textC no="1698-1718" no="1719-1739" no="1740-1760" no="1761-1781" no="1782-1802" no="1803-1823" no="1824-1844" no="1845-1865" no="1866-1886" no="1887-1907" no="1908-1928" no="1929-1949" no="1950-1970" no="1971-1991" no="1992-2012" no="2013-2033">
which Colony also furnished coal to thevalue of 1,125,281*., out of a total value of 1,839,282*. The total mineral production of Australasia to the end of 1896 was estimated at 503,170,096*., of which 110,368,525*. was contributed by New South Wales. The total amount of Australasian public revenue during'1896 was30,690,226*., as follows :—New South Wales, 9,309,269*. ; Victoria, 6,629,613*. ; New Zealand, r4,798,708*. ; Queensland, 3,613,150*. ; Western Australia, 2,842,751*. ; South Australia, 2,698,759 l. ; Tasmania, 797,976 l.
</text>

<text id="467sc105979932">
<textF no="1698-1704" no="1705-1711" no="1712-1718" no="1719-1725" no="1726-1732" no="1733-1739" no="1740-1746" no="1747-1753" no="1754-1760" no="1761-1767" no="1768-1774" no="1775-1781" no="1782-1788" no="1789-1795" no="1796-1802" no="1803-1809" no="1810-1816" no="1817-1823" no="1824-1830" no="1831-1837" no="1838-1844" no="1845-1851" no="1852-1858" no="1859-1865" no="1866-1872" no="1873-1879" no="1880-1886" no="1887-1893" no="1894-1900" no="1901-1907" no="1908-1914" no="1915-1921" no="1922-1928" no="1929-1935" no="1936-1942" no="1943-1949" no="1950-1956" no="1957-1963" no="1964-1970" no="1971-1977" no="1978-1984" no="1985-1991" no="1992-1998" no="1999-2005" no="2006-2012" no="2013-2019">
<textM no="1702-1714" no="1715-1727" no="1728-1740" no="1741-1753" no="1754-1766" no="1767-1779" no="1780-1792" no="1793-1805" no="1806-1818" no="1819-1831" no="1832-1844" no="1845-1857" no="1858-1870" no="1871-1883" no="1884-1896" no="1897-1909" no="1910-1922" no="1923-1935" no="1936-1948" no="1949-1961" no="1962-1974" no="1975-1987" no="1988-2000" no="2001-2013">
<textC no="1698-1718" no="1719-1739" no="1740-1760" no="1761-1781" no="1782-1802" no="1803-1823" no="1824-1844" no="1845-1865" no="1866-1886" no="1887-1907" no="1908-1928" no="1929-1949" no="1950-1970" no="1971-1991" no="1992-2012" no="2013-2033">
The Danish Troops are all march'd out of Bavaria ; several of their Regiments have already pass'd by this Place in their way to Presburg, and the others continue to follow daily. Count Wackerbart, King Augustus's Envoy to this Court, accompanied by the Envoys of the other Princes of Saxony, receiv'd on the 9th Instant the Investiture of the Imperial Fiefs posses'd by that Family, On Thursday last Major-General Palmes set out from hence on his Journey to Turin.
</text>

<text id="755qb9711410932">
<textF no="1699-1705" no="1706-1712" no="1713-1719" no="1720-1726" no="1727-1733" no="1734-1740" no="1741-1747" no="1748-1754" no="1755-1761" no="1762-1768" no="1769-1775" no="1776-1782" no="1783-1789" no="1790-1796" no="1797-1803" no="1804-1810" no="1811-1817" no="1818-1824" no="1825-1831" no="1832-1838" no="1839-1845" no="1846-1852" no="1853-1859" no="1860-1866" no="1867-1873" no="1874-1880" no="1881-1887" no="1888-1894" no="1895-1901" no="1902-1908" no="1909-1915" no="1916-1922" no="1923-1929" no="1930-1936" no="1937-1943" no="1944-1950" no="1951-1957" no="1958-1964" no="1965-1971" no="1972-1978" no="1979-1985" no="1986-1992" no="1993-1999" no="2000-2006" no="2007-2013">
<textM no="1704-1716" no="1717-1729" no="1730-1742" no="1743-1755" no="1756-1768" no="1769-1781" no="1782-1794" no="1795-1807" no="1808-1820" no="1821-1833" no="1834-1846" no="1847-1859" no="1860-1872" no="1873-1885" no="1886-1898" no="1899-1911" no="1912-1924" no="1925-1937" no="1938-1950" no="1951-1963" no="1964-1976" no="1977-1989" no="1990-2002" no="2003-2015">
<textC no="1699-1719" no="1720-1740" no="1741-1761" no="1762-1782" no="1783-1803" no="1804-1824" no="1825-1845" no="1846-1866" no="1867-1887" no="1888-1908" no="1909-1929" no="1930-1950" no="1951-1971" no="1972-1992" no="1993-2013">
In a county north of the metropolis, (it matters not where) lived, in a retired spot, a private family of some consideration, both with respect to connection and for- tune ; but being happy in themselves, and there being a numerous progeny, no less' than ten children, with a prospect of afurther increase in its numbers, the pancipals sought but little communicationwith the world, and appeared as much removed from any of the contaminations of society, either mental or corporeal, as persons moving in a superior sphere could possibly be	supposed. For	several month before the catastrophe which I am about to relate, they had been even unusually separated from all society by a very severe winter, and roads more than commonly impassable.
</text>

<text id="109ld1083211132">
<textF no="1702-1708" no="1709-1715" no="1716-1722" no="1723-1729" no="1730-1736" no="1737-1743" no="1744-1750" no="1751-1757" no="1758-1764" no="1765-1771" no="1772-1778" no="1779-1785" no="1786-1792" no="1793-1799" no="1800-1806" no="1807-1813" no="1814-1820" no="1821-1827" no="1828-1834" no="1835-1841" no="1842-1848" no="1849-1855" no="1856-1862" no="1863-1869" no="1870-1876" no="1877-1883" no="1884-1890" no="1891-1897" no="1898-1904" no="1905-1911" no="1912-1918" no="1919-1925" no="1926-1932" no="1933-1939" no="1940-1946" no="1947-1953" no="1954-1960" no="1961-1967" no="1968-1974" no="1975-1981" no="1982-1988" no="1989-1995" no="1996-2002" no="2003-2009" no="2010-2016">
<textM no="1702-1714" no="1715-1727" no="1728-1740" no="1741-1753" no="1754-1766" no="1767-1779" no="1780-1792" no="1793-1805" no="1806-1818" no="1819-1831" no="1832-1844" no="1845-1857" no="1858-1870" no="1871-1883" no="1884-1896" no="1897-1909" no="1910-1922" no="1923-1935" no="1936-1948" no="1949-1961" no="1962-1974" no="1975-1987" no="1988-2000" no="2001-2013">
<textC no="1702-1722" no="1723-1743" no="1744-1764" no="1765-1785" no="1786-1806" no="1807-1827" no="1828-1848" no="1849-1869" no="1870-1890" no="1891-1911" no="1912-1932" no="1933-1953" no="1954-1974" no="1975-1995" no="1996-2016">
Mr. Wakley was now again the operator of this experiment of influence of the mesmerism on the human frame.
</text>

<text id="271hf323297104">
<textF no="1700-1706" no="1707-1713" no="1714-1720" no="1721-1727" no="1728-1734" no="1735-1741" no="1742-1748" no="1749-1755" no="1756-1762" no="1763-1769" no="1770-1776" no="1777-1783" no="1784-1790" no="1791-1797" no="1798-1804" no="1805-1811" no="1812-1818" no="1819-1825" no="1826-1832" no="1833-1839" no="1840-1846" no="1847-1853" no="1854-1860" no="1861-1867" no="1868-1874" no="1875-1881" no="1882-1888" no="1889-1895" no="1896-1902" no="1903-1909" no="1910-1916" no="1917-1923" no="1924-1930" no="1931-1937" no="1938-1944" no="1945-1951" no="1952-1958" no="1959-1965" no="1966-1972" no="1973-1979" no="1980-1986" no="1987-1993" no="1994-2000" no="2001-2007" no="2008-2014">
<textM no="1698-1710" no="1711-1723" no="1724-1736" no="1737-1749" no="1750-1762" no="1763-1775" no="1776-1788" no="1789-1801" no="1802-1814" no="1815-1827" no="1828-1840" no="1841-1853" no="1854-1866" no="1867-1879" no="1880-1892" no="1893-1905" no="1906-1918" no="1919-1931" no="1932-1944" no="1945-1957" no="1958-1970" no="1971-1983" no="1984-1996" no="1997-2009" no="2010-2022">
<textC no="1707-1727" no="1728-1748" no="1749-1769" no="1770-1790" no="1791-1811" no="1812-1832" no="1833-1853" no="1854-1874" no="1875-1895" no="1896-1916" no="1917-1937" no="1938-1958" no="1959-1979" no="1980-2000" no="2001-2021">
Our Men afterwards began the Attack of the Citadel, but that being provided with Artillery, and in a good State of Defence, a Reinforcement of Horse and foot is sent thither, under the Command o f Major-General Rocenhan. We shall know the Success of this Enterprize.
</text>

<text id="192ia11410597110">
<textF no="1701-1707" no="1708-1714" no="1715-1721" no="1722-1728" no="1729-1735" no="1736-1742" no="1743-1749" no="1750-1756" no="1757-1763" no="1764-1770" no="1771-1777" no="1778-1784" no="1785-1791" no="1792-1798" no="1799-1805" no="1806-1812" no="1813-1819" no="1820-1826" no="1827-1833" no="1834-1840" no="1841-1847" no="1848-1854" no="1855-1861" no="1862-1868" no="1869-1875" no="1876-1882" no="1883-1889" no="1890-1896" no="1897-1903" no="1904-1910" no="1911-1917" no="1918-1924" no="1925-1931" no="1932-1938" no="1939-1945" no="1946-1952" no="1953-1959" no="1960-1966" no="1967-1973" no="1974-1980" no="1981-1987" no="1988-1994" no="1995-2001" no="2002-2008" no="2009-2015">
<textM no="1699-1711" no="1712-1724" no="1725-1737" no="1738-1750" no="1751-1763" no="1764-1776" no="1777-1789" no="1790-1802" no="1803-1815" no="1816-1828" no="1829-1841" no="1842-1854" no="1855-1867" no="1868-1880" no="1881-1893" no="1894-1906" no="1907-1919" no="1920-1932" no="1933-1945" no="1946-1958" no="1959-1971" no="1972-1984" no="1985-1997" no="1998-2010" no="2011-2023">
<textC no="1708-1728" no="1729-1749" no="1750-1770" no="1771-1791" no="1792-1812" no="1813-1833" no="1834-1854" no="1855-1875" no="1876-1896" no="1897-1917" no="1918-1938" no="1939-1959" no="1960-1980" no="1981-2001" no="2002-2022">
in order to load him with greater Ignominy, the Courtierson Pretence of Respect to the Church mov'd that before Execution of the Sentence he shou'd be degraded from the Order of Priesthood.
</text>

<text id="180ak9711411132">
<textF no="1702-1708" no="1709-1715" no="1716-1722" no="1723-1729" no="1730-1736" no="1737-1743" no="1744-1750" no="1751-1757" no="1758-1764" no="1765-1771" no="1772-1778" no="1779-1785" no="1786-1792" no="1793-1799" no="1800-1806" no="1807-1813" no="1814-1820" no="1821-1827" no="1828-1834" no="1835-1841" no="1842-1848" no="1849-1855" no="1856-1862" no="1863-1869" no="1870-1876" no="1877-1883" no="1884-1890" no="1891-1897" no="1898-1904" no="1905-1911" no="1912-1918" no="1919-1925" no="1926-1932" no="1933-1939" no="1940-1946" no="1947-1953" no="1954-1960" no="1961-1967" no="1968-1974" no="1975-1981" no="1982-1988" no="1989-1995" no="1996-2002" no="2003-2009" no="2010-2016">
<textM no="1700-1712" no="1713-1725" no="1726-1738" no="1739-1751" no="1752-1764" no="1765-1777" no="1778-1790" no="1791-1803" no="1804-1816" no="1817-1829" no="1830-1842" no="1843-1855" no="1856-1868" no="1869-1881" no="1882-1894" no="1895-1907" no="1908-1920" no="1921-1933" no="1934-1946" no="1947-1959" no="1960-1972" no="1973-1985" no="1986-1998" no="1999-2011" no="2012-2024">
<textC no="1709-1729" no="1730-1750" no="1751-1771" no="1772-1792" no="1793-1813" no="1814-1834" no="1835-1855" no="1856-1876" no="1877-1897" no="1898-1918" no="1919-1939" no="1940-1960" no="1961-1981" no="1982-2002" no="2003-2023">
for assaulting George Floyer on the High Way and taking from him a pair of Pistols value 40 s. a Hoster-Cloth value 15 s. a pair of Spurs value 5 s. and a Gelding value 30 l.
</text>

<text id="240nl101108108115">
<textF no="1704-1710" no="1711-1717" no="1718-1724" no="1725-1731" no="1732-1738" no="1739-1745" no="1746-1752" no="1753-1759" no="1760-1766" no="1767-1773" no="1774-1780" no="1781-1787" no="1788-1794" no="1795-1801" no="1802-1808" no="1809-1815" no="1816-1822" no="1823-1829" no="1830-1836" no="1837-1843" no="1844-1850" no="1851-1857" no="1858-1864" no="1865-1871" no="1872-1878" no="1879-1885" no="1886-1892" no="1893-1899" no="1900-1906" no="1907-1913" no="1914-1920" no="1921-1927" no="1928-1934" no="1935-1941" no="1942-1948" no="1949-1955" no="1956-1962" no="1963-1969" no="1970-1976" no="1977-1983" no="1984-1990" no="1991-1997" no="1998-2004" no="2005-2011" no="2012-2018">
<textM no="1695-1707" no="1708-1720" no="1721-1733" no="1734-1746" no="1747-1759" no="1760-1772" no="1773-1785" no="1786-1798" no="1799-1811" no="1812-1824" no="1825-1837" no="1838-1850" no="1851-1863" no="1864-1876" no="1877-1889" no="1890-1902" no="1903-1915" no="1916-1928" no="1929-1941" no="1942-1954" no="1955-1967" no="1968-1980" no="1981-1993" no="1994-2006" no="2007-2019">
<textC no="1711-1731" no="1732-1752" no="1753-1773" no="1774-1794" no="1795-1815" no="1816-1836" no="1837-1857" no="1858-1878" no="1879-1899" no="1900-1920" no="1921-1941" no="1942-1962" no="1963-1983" no="1984-2004" no="2005-2025">
A little gleam of light revealed. At last the hour which was to make Kenneth Lisle and Coral one had arrived, and the bride was awaiting the coming of the bridegroom with beating heart, her proud face flushed with pride and triumph.
</text>

<text id="204pb11010297105">
<textF no="1700-1706" no="1707-1713" no="1714-1720" no="1721-1727" no="1728-1734" no="1735-1741" no="1742-1748" no="1749-1755" no="1756-1762" no="1763-1769" no="1770-1776" no="1777-1783" no="1784-1790" no="1791-1797" no="1798-1804" no="1805-1811" no="1812-1818" no="1819-1825" no="1826-1832" no="1833-1839" no="1840-1846" no="1847-1853" no="1854-1860" no="1861-1867" no="1868-1874" no="1875-1881" no="1882-1888" no="1889-1895" no="1896-1902" no="1903-1909" no="1910-1916" no="1917-1923" no="1924-1930" no="1931-1937" no="1938-1944" no="1945-1951" no="1952-1958" no="1959-1965" no="1966-1972" no="1973-1979" no="1980-1986" no="1987-1993" no="1994-2000" no="2001-2007" no="2008-2014">
<textM no="1704-1716" no="1717-1729" no="1730-1742" no="1743-1755" no="1756-1768" no="1769-1781" no="1782-1794" no="1795-1807" no="1808-1820" no="1821-1833" no="1834-1846" no="1847-1859" no="1860-1872" no="1873-1885" no="1886-1898" no="1899-1911" no="1912-1924" no="1925-1937" no="1938-1950" no="1951-1963" no="1964-1976" no="1977-1989" no="1990-2002" no="2003-2015">
<textC no="1700-1720" no="1721-1741" no="1742-1762" no="1763-1783" no="1784-1804" no="1805-1825" no="1826-1846" no="1847-1867" no="1868-1888" no="1889-1909" no="1910-1930" no="1931-1951" no="1952-1972" no="1973-1993" no="1994-2014">
Paternal Coats of Arms of each Family in Blazon. Collected as well from our best Historian, publick Records and other sufficient Authorities, as from the personal Information of most of the Nobility.
</text>

<text id="264rc97108115114">
<textF no="1701-1707" no="1708-1714" no="1715-1721" no="1722-1728" no="1729-1735" no="1736-1742" no="1743-1749" no="1750-1756" no="1757-1763" no="1764-1770" no="1771-1777" no="1778-1784" no="1785-1791" no="1792-1798" no="1799-1805" no="1806-1812" no="1813-1819" no="1820-1826" no="1827-1833" no="1834-1840" no="1841-1847" no="1848-1854" no="1855-1861" no="1862-1868" no="1869-1875" no="1876-1882" no="1883-1889" no="1890-1896" no="1897-1903" no="1904-1910" no="1911-1917" no="1918-1924" no="1925-1931" no="1932-1938" no="1939-1945" no="1946-1952" no="1953-1959" no="1960-1966" no="1967-1973" no="1974-1980" no="1981-1987" no="1988-1994" no="1995-2001" no="2002-2008" no="2009-2015">
<textM no="1700-1712" no="1713-1725" no="1726-1738" no="1739-1751" no="1752-1764" no="1765-1777" no="1778-1790" no="1791-1803" no="1804-1816" no="1817-1829" no="1830-1842" no="1843-1855" no="1856-1868" no="1869-1881" no="1882-1894" no="1895-1907" no="1908-1920" no="1921-1933" no="1934-1946" no="1947-1959" no="1960-1972" no="1973-1985" no="1986-1998" no="1999-2011" no="2012-2024">
<textC no="1701-1721" no="1722-1742" no="1743-1763" no="1764-1784" no="1785-1805" no="1806-1826" no="1827-1847" no="1848-1868" no="1869-1889" no="1890-1910" no="1911-1931" no="1932-1952" no="1953-1973" no="1974-1994" no="1995-2015">
our Pay was absolutely necessary for bringing about those good Ends so now I am of Opinion, that the keeping up the Number of our own Forces proposed, is a Measure that is absolutely necessary for preserving that Tranquility which is but just established.
</text>

<text id="154rm101111116105">
<textF no="1700-1706" no="1707-1713" no="1714-1720" no="1721-1727" no="1728-1734" no="1735-1741" no="1742-1748" no="1749-1755" no="1756-1762" no="1763-1769" no="1770-1776" no="1777-1783" no="1784-1790" no="1791-1797" no="1798-1804" no="1805-1811" no="1812-1818" no="1819-1825" no="1826-1832" no="1833-1839" no="1840-1846" no="1847-1853" no="1854-1860" no="1861-1867" no="1868-1874" no="1875-1881" no="1882-1888" no="1889-1895" no="1896-1902" no="1903-1909" no="1910-1916" no="1917-1923" no="1924-1930" no="1931-1937" no="1938-1944" no="1945-1951" no="1952-1958" no="1959-1965" no="1966-1972" no="1973-1979" no="1980-1986" no="1987-1993" no="1994-2000" no="2001-2007" no="2008-2014">
<textM no="1704-1716" no="1717-1729" no="1730-1742" no="1743-1755" no="1756-1768" no="1769-1781" no="1782-1794" no="1795-1807" no="1808-1820" no="1821-1833" no="1834-1846" no="1847-1859" no="1860-1872" no="1873-1885" no="1886-1898" no="1899-1911" no="1912-1924" no="1925-1937" no="1938-1950" no="1951-1963" no="1964-1976" no="1977-1989" no="1990-2002" no="2003-2015">
<textC no="1700-1720" no="1721-1741" no="1742-1762" no="1763-1783" no="1784-1804" no="1805-1825" no="1826-1846" no="1847-1867" no="1868-1888" no="1889-1909" no="1910-1930" no="1931-1951" no="1952-1972" no="1973-1993" no="1994-2014">
A new Set of Maps of two Sheets of imperial Paper, laid from the Observations of Mr. Halley, Professor of geometry at Oxen and mr. Heuchus of Dantzick.
</text>

<text id="248sq11511011732">
<textF no="1701-1707" no="1708-1714" no="1715-1721" no="1722-1728" no="1729-1735" no="1736-1742" no="1743-1749" no="1750-1756" no="1757-1763" no="1764-1770" no="1771-1777" no="1778-1784" no="1785-1791" no="1792-1798" no="1799-1805" no="1806-1812" no="1813-1819" no="1820-1826" no="1827-1833" no="1834-1840" no="1841-1847" no="1848-1854" no="1855-1861" no="1862-1868" no="1869-1875" no="1876-1882" no="1883-1889" no="1890-1896" no="1897-1903" no="1904-1910" no="1911-1917" no="1918-1924" no="1925-1931" no="1932-1938" no="1939-1945" no="1946-1952" no="1953-1959" no="1960-1966" no="1967-1973" no="1974-1980" no="1981-1987" no="1988-1994" no="1995-2001" no="2002-2008" no="2009-2015">
<textM no="1699-1711" no="1712-1724" no="1725-1737" no="1738-1750" no="1751-1763" no="1764-1776" no="1777-1789" no="1790-1802" no="1803-1815" no="1816-1828" no="1829-1841" no="1842-1854" no="1855-1867" no="1868-1880" no="1881-1893" no="1894-1906" no="1907-1919" no="1920-1932" no="1933-1945" no="1946-1958" no="1959-1971" no="1972-1984" no="1985-1997" no="1998-2010" no="2011-2023">
<textC no="1708-1728" no="1729-1749" no="1750-1770" no="1771-1791" no="1792-1812" no="1813-1833" no="1834-1854" no="1855-1875" no="1876-1896" no="1897-1917" no="1918-1938" no="1939-1959" no="1960-1980" no="1981-2001" no="2002-2022">
There is arrived in our Harbours a Fleet of twenty one East India Ships. The fine Church of the Jesuites at Antwerp hath been destroy'd by Lighting with all curious Paintings &c. There is a great Insurrection in Brussels were several have fallen
</text>

<text id="697fm1014611497">
<textF no="1704-1710" no="1711-1717" no="1718-1724" no="1725-1731" no="1732-1738" no="1739-1745" no="1746-1752" no="1753-1759" no="1760-1766" no="1767-1773" no="1774-1780" no="1781-1787" no="1788-1794" no="1795-1801" no="1802-1808" no="1809-1815" no="1816-1822" no="1823-1829" no="1830-1836" no="1837-1843" no="1844-1850" no="1851-1857" no="1858-1864" no="1865-1871" no="1872-1878" no="1879-1885" no="1886-1892" no="1893-1899" no="1900-1906" no="1907-1913" no="1914-1920" no="1921-1927" no="1928-1934" no="1935-1941" no="1942-1948" no="1949-1955" no="1956-1962" no="1963-1969" no="1970-1976" no="1977-1983" no="1984-1990" no="1991-1997" no="1998-2004" no="2005-2011" no="2012-2018">
<textM no="1695-1707" no="1708-1720" no="1721-1733" no="1734-1746" no="1747-1759" no="1760-1772" no="1773-1785" no="1786-1798" no="1799-1811" no="1812-1824" no="1825-1837" no="1838-1850" no="1851-1863" no="1864-1876" no="1877-1889" no="1890-1902" no="1903-1915" no="1916-1928" no="1929-1941" no="1942-1954" no="1955-1967" no="1968-1980" no="1981-1993" no="1994-2006" no="2007-2019">
<textC no="1711-1731" no="1732-1752" no="1753-1773" no="1774-1794" no="1795-1815" no="1816-1836" no="1837-1857" no="1858-1878" no="1879-1899" no="1900-1920" no="1921-1941" no="1942-1962" no="1963-1983" no="1984-2004" no="2005-2025">
There are the. particulars,” the assistant day editor said, handing her a yellow form filled out with the name of the mau to be interviewed and the items of information ascertained in regard top this case. , We want the story for Sunday's issue, so you will have to come back and write it to-night," Mr. Astroyd said not unkindly.“ All right,” Hester flung back, as she tripped lightly out of the office, her cheeks aglow and her eyes alight with all a reporter's enthusiasm.“ Pretty girl that,” Mr. Astroyd remarked as the sound of Hester's quick, firm steps died away in the distance. “ And the best of it is she never seems to know it.	She's always to be relied upon.”
</text>

<text id="241ha114104101114">
<textF no="1702-1708" no="1709-1715" no="1716-1722" no="1723-1729" no="1730-1736" no="1737-1743" no="1744-1750" no="1751-1757" no="1758-1764" no="1765-1771" no="1772-1778" no="1779-1785" no="1786-1792" no="1793-1799" no="1800-1806" no="1807-1813" no="1814-1820" no="1821-1827" no="1828-1834" no="1835-1841" no="1842-1848" no="1849-1855" no="1856-1862" no="1863-1869" no="1870-1876" no="1877-1883" no="1884-1890" no="1891-1897" no="1898-1904" no="1905-1911" no="1912-1918" no="1919-1925" no="1926-1932" no="1933-1939" no="1940-1946" no="1947-1953" no="1954-1960" no="1961-1967" no="1968-1974" no="1975-1981" no="1982-1988" no="1989-1995" no="1996-2002" no="2003-2009" no="2010-2016">
